I'm trying to simplify the following expression which I've shorted
⊢ ↑0 + γ ...
Zero is being cast to a real here. rw zero_add doesn't seem to work, though simp does. Is there a trick to doing this using rw?
you need a lemma that tells you that ↑0 = 0, you can use squeeze_simp to find that specific lemma. you can also use norm_cast
wow. wish I had known about squeeze_simp earlier :smile:
King Crawford has marked this topic as resolved.
Kevin's Lean course has a good overview of all the important tactics and common tricks on how to use them: https://www.ma.imperial.ac.uk/~buzzard/xena/formalising-mathematics-2022/Part_C/Part_C.html
thanks. I got through about half of it and decided to take a break. haha
I meant this rather https://github.com/ImperialCollegeLondon/formalising-mathematics-2022.git. Haven't come across the documentation you linked.
